001/*

005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.adapter;
007
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.jsonFormatVisitors.JsonFormatTypes;
009
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.AbstractCustomJavaDataTypeAdapter;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.object.AmbiguousDate;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.MetapathConstants;
013import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.IDateItem;
014import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.EQNameFactory;
015import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.IEnhancedQName;
016import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
017
018import java.time.LocalDate;
019import java.time.LocalTime;
020import java.time.ZoneOffset;
021import java.time.ZonedDateTime;
022import java.time.format.DateTimeParseException;
023import java.time.temporal.TemporalAccessor;
024import java.util.List;
025import java.util.regex.Matcher;
026import java.util.regex.Pattern;
027
028import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
029
030/**
031 * Support for the Metaschema <a href=
032 * "https://pages.nist.gov/metaschema/specification/datatypes/#date">date</a>
033 * data type.
034 */
035public class DateAdapter
036    extends AbstractCustomJavaDataTypeAdapter<AmbiguousDate, IDateItem> {
037  @NonNull
038  private static final List<IEnhancedQName> NAMES = ObjectUtils.notNull(
039      List.of(
040          EQNameFactory.instance().newQName(MetapathConstants.NS_METAPATH, "date")));
041  @NonNull
042  private static final Pattern DATE_TIMEZONE = ObjectUtils.notNull(
043      Pattern.compile("^("
044          + "^(?:(?:2000|2400|2800|(?:19|2[0-9](?:0[48]|[2468][048]|[13579][26])))-02-29)"
045          + "|(?:(?:(?:19|2[0-9])[0-9]{2})-02-(?:0[1-9]|1[0-9]|2[0-8]))"
046          + "|(?:(?:(?:19|2[0-9])[0-9]{2})-(?:0[13578]|10|12)-(?:0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01]))"
047          + "|(?:(?:(?:19|2[0-9])[0-9]{2})-(?:0[469]|11)-(?:0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|30))"
048          + ")"
049          + "(Z|[+-][0-9]{2}:[0-9]{2})?$"));
050
051  DateAdapter() {
052    super(AmbiguousDate.class, IDateItem.class, IDateItem::cast);
053  }
054
055  @Override
056  public List<IEnhancedQName> getNames() {
057    return NAMES;
058  }
059
060  @Override
061  public JsonFormatTypes getJsonRawType() {
062    return JsonFormatTypes.STRING;
063  }
064
065  @Override
066  public AmbiguousDate parse(String value) {
067    Matcher matcher = DATE_TIMEZONE.matcher(value);
068    if (!matcher.matches()) {
069      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid date: " + value);
070    }
071
072    String parseValue
073        = String.format("%sT00:00:00%s", matcher.group(1), matcher.group(2) == null ? "" : matcher.group(2));
074    try {
075      TemporalAccessor accessor = DateFormats.DATE_TIME_WITH_TZ.parse(parseValue);
076      return new AmbiguousDate(ObjectUtils.notNull(ZonedDateTime.from(accessor)), true); // NOPMD - readability
077    } catch (DateTimeParseException ex) {
078      try {
079        TemporalAccessor accessor = DateFormats.DATE_TIME_WITH_OPTIONAL_TZ.parse(parseValue);
080        LocalDate date = LocalDate.from(accessor);
081        return new AmbiguousDate(ObjectUtils.notNull(ZonedDateTime.of(date, LocalTime.MIN, ZoneOffset.UTC)), false);
082      } catch (DateTimeParseException ex2) {
083        IllegalArgumentException newEx = new IllegalArgumentException(ex2.getLocalizedMessage(), ex2);
084        newEx.addSuppressed(ex);
085        throw newEx; // NOPMD - false positive
086      }
087    }
088  }
089
090  @Override
091  public String asString(Object obj) {
092    AmbiguousDate value = toValue(obj);
093    return ObjectUtils.notNull(value.hasTimeZone()
094        ? DateFormats.DATE_WITH_TZ.format(value.getValue())
095        : DateFormats.DATE_WITH_OPTIONAL_TZ.format(value.getValue()));
096  }
097
098  @Override
099  public IDateItem newItem(Object value) {
100    AmbiguousDate item = toValue(value);
101    return IDateItem.valueOf(item);
102  }
103}
